thread.title: APNewsBreak: Top Biden aide lays out potential 2016 platform
thread.title_full: APNewsBreak: Top Biden aide lays out potential 2016 platform

title: APNewsBreak: Top Biden aide lays out potential 2016 platform
text:
Updated: 10:04 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015 | Posted: 10:04 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015 APNewsBreak: Top Biden aide lays out potential 2016 platform Related View Larger Vice President Joe Biden reacts to questions about his potential run for president by members of the media as he waits for South Korean President Park Geun-hye to arrive for lunch at the Naval Observatory, Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015, in Washington. (AP Photo/Andrew Harnik) Sponsored Links The Associated Press WASHINGTON â€” 
One of Vice President Joe Biden's top political advisers says he'll make a decision soon about whether to run for president. 
Former Delaware Sen. Ted Kaufman is one of Biden's closest aides. He's telling former Biden staffers in a letter that Biden will need help from all of them if he runs. 
The emailed letter was sent to former staffers Thursday and obtained by The Associated Press. 
Kaufman says he doesn't know if Biden will run. He says Biden's top consideration is his family's welfare. 
Kaufman says if Biden runs, it will be because of his "burning conviction" that the U.S. must fundamentally change the balance in the economy. He says Biden would run to help the middle class restore its ability to get ahead. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WHIO-TV Daily Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
